text:
Another reminder for Tory MPs deciding which leadership contender & which Brexit plan to back:
We voted Leave to take back control of our laws, our borders & our money. That means no single market, no customs union & no ECJ.
If we remain in any of them, it’s not Brexit.
author: JuliaHB1

text: 983 days too long
author: JuliaHB1

text:
A reminder to Brexiteer Tory MPs:

It is BREXIT that matters to Leave voters, not your internal party squabbles. 

We don’t care about your egos, ambitions or feuds. We care about our democratic vote being delivered. That’s it.

Keep your eyes on the real prize:

BREXIT.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Unlike other Brexiteers, I’m not questioning the huge numbers claimed by the @peoplesvote_uk #marchagainstdemocracy today. It wasn’t just Waitrose - the Hampstead branch of Waterstone’s was virtually empty too. That’s 20,000-plus on the march at least.
author: JuliaHB1

text:
Huge thanks to the @peoplesvote_uk folk for organising their march against democracy today. The Waitrose car park was virtually empty and no queue at the tills! 

Could you do a march every Saturday? It would make life so much easier for the rest of us metropolitan elite.

text: And yes, I know that’s more than the three tweets this thread planned to be....
author: JuliaHB1

text: ... mass murder by a white supremacist racist lunatic, then something is going horribly wrong in our public discourse. This is a blatant attempt to exploit this crime, to intimidate, to censor & divide us. It will not succeed.
author: JuliaHB1

text: And no, I don’t think I’m a “victim”. The victims of this terror attack are lying in the morgue or fighting for their lives in hospital. But when people expressing reasonable & mainstream views are labelled as “far right” or “fascist” or “Islamophobic” & blamed for inspiring...
author: JuliaHB1

text: And some more 4/4
author: JuliaHB1

text: So here’s just a small taste of the tweets sent to me in the wake of Friday’s terror attack. Too many screenshots for one tweet so this is 3/4
author: JuliaHB1

text: The accusation is that anyone who speaks out in favour of controlled immigration, of the need for integration of diverse communities or against Islamic extremism, the burka or niqab or sharia law is EXACTLY THE SAME as the mass murderer who killed 50 innocent people. 2/3
author: JuliaHB1

text: The haste with which the illiberal Left sought to exploit the murder of 50 Muslims in the New Zealand terror attack is sickening. I am just one of many “right wing” commentators (coincidentally all Brexiteers) accused of having “blood on my hands” for that horrific massacre. 1/3
author: JuliaHB1

text: I see the Remoaners are losing their shit again this week. Kinder gentler politics. Usual lovely tweets.
author: JuliaHB1

text: And did you feel that way about me when I worked for the Guardian? Lol.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Aw shucks.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Well, you must know best.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Er, I realise you may not be the sharpest pencil in the box, as your tweet proves, but I am not interviewing Bannon on my radio show & have no urge to do so. Sky News are interviewing him. Do try to keep up.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Ok, dumbass. We don’t have the 1st amendment in the UK. You can turn the TV or radio off if you don’t want to listen. In order for “hate speech” to be a criminal offence it has to fulfil specific criteria which are rather narrower than you or anyone else saying you don’t like it.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Absobloodylutely. And so would every journalist. Interviewing someone doesn’t mean you agree with them.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Er, they already are
author: JuliaHB1

text: Am I? Do give some examples.
author: JuliaHB1

text: You invite these people on air to challenge them and expose them.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Jesus, have you got your tin hat on?
author: JuliaHB1

text: You’re an idiot
author: JuliaHB1

text: Actually, we do often hear the views of people who hold opinions many of us dislike. Not hearing them doesn’t make them disappear.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Yes, actually it is, I’m afraid. Unless it’s specifically forbidden by law.
author: JuliaHB1

text: And the Health Secretary has said there will be no shortages. Why on earth would there be?!
author: JuliaHB1

text: There will not be shortages of vital medicines after Brexit. Full stop.
author: JuliaHB1

text: You, Kim, are a disgrace for complaining about hearing alternative viewpoints in the media. I despise Bannon but it doesn’t mean he should be banned from our screens. If you don’t like free speech, go and live in a country where it’s not allowed. I’m sure you’d be much happier.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Ta
author: JuliaHB1

text: Brian has blocked me - not sure why - so I can’t see his original tweet. Can you screenshot it?
author: JuliaHB1

text: Yeah, luckily there won’t be any leadership battles when Jeremy Corbyn is Prime Minister #OurDearLeader
author: JuliaHB1

text: Yep
author: JuliaHB1

text: Brave is exploiting your cancer patients to make a snide point to promote your anti-democratic Remoaner views.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Terrifying. Dumb students blame Chelsea Clinton for NZ massacre of Muslims because she has denounced anti-semitism. WTAF? These people of completely insane. And dangerous.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Genuinely worried that a news journalist of so much experience didn’t bother to check whether kids are already taught about climate change at school. They are.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Good morning! Please join me for my #NoNonsense @talkRADIO breakfast show from 6.30am to 10am. We’ll be talking about The Great Brexital Betrayal, the New Zealand terror attack, Love Island suicide, junk food ads, plus Stacey Solomon on internet slang & Michael Buerk on memory
author: JuliaHB1

text: Lightweight
author: JuliaHB1

text: Helloooo!
author: JuliaHB1

text: A most excellent thread on the attempts by some to exploit the New Zealand terror attack.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Monday happened much faster than I expected
author: JuliaHB1

text: Go away Femi
author: JuliaHB1

text: Ooh, tomorrow is Brexit Betrayal Eve. Just two more sleeps until we find out whether we still live in a democracy or not. Night all.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Yeah, pregnancy hormones are like that
author: JuliaHB1

text: Oh, like we did before we joined a federal political union?
author: JuliaHB1

text: Tell you what, why don’t we Brexit first and then see...?
author: JuliaHB1

text: Sigh
author: JuliaHB1

text: Yes! Yes! Yes!
author: JuliaHB1

text: What a pathetic response
author: JuliaHB1

text: Imagine doing it every morning...
author: JuliaHB1

text: Yeah, I mean, it seems perfectly reasonable for MPs to get the final say on Brexit, doesn’t it...?
author: JuliaHB1

text: Do try to keep up
author: JuliaHB1

text: X
author: JuliaHB1

text: Finished watching it this afternoon. Tried to eke it out for days to enjoy it for longer. Just beautiful. Laughed and cried.
author: JuliaHB1

text: FFS.
author: JuliaHB1

text: This is the Tories' last chance to reject May's deal, press reset and undo her appalling mistakes. @DanielJHannan via @telegraph
author: JuliaHB1

text: Travis, you are so gloriously stupid and out of touch.
author: JuliaHB1

text: I give it four...
author: JuliaHB1

text: I keep seeing tweets about Brexiteer MPs who have “changed their minds” & will now vote for Theresa May’s deal. They haven’t changed their minds, they still know her deal is terrible. They’ve been bullied & blackmailed by a Remain Parliament threatening to stop Brexit altogether.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Tory Brexiteer MPs could vote for May’s deal (which we all know isn’t Brexit) in the face of a Remain Parliament. Or they could threaten to bring down this Govt in a no confidence vote & force a general election so we voters can elect MPs who DO represent our views on Brexit.
author: JuliaHB1

text: You are so wrong on this. Nick Boles is a good man but he is working to undermine the result of a democratic vote. He doesn’t deserve to be an MP.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Want
author: JuliaHB1

text: There’s an awful lot of stupid on Twitter today. Just saying.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Do go away now. Keep trying to make this about you and trying to promote yourself and get Twitter likes, and I’ll keep saying what I want. I couldn’t give a toss what anyone but my friends and family think about me. You should try thinking for yourself sometime. It helps.
author: JuliaHB1

text: I’m three episodes in. It’s brilliant. Makes you laugh AND cry.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Oh sorry, so no one is allowed to comment on ANYTHING that has affected ANYONE EVER if they themselves have not been a victim of it? Do fuck off and take your sixth form debating society arguments with you.
author: JuliaHB1

text:
... strikes me as being alarmingly similar to the views of the NZ killer. Maybe it is you who should look again at what are you saying.
9. I’m done with this now. Bye bye.  4/
author: JuliaHB1

text:
7. I do stand by my words. If you think that makes me a white supremacist or someone who thinks it’s ok to murder people who don’t share my faith or skin colour then you are certifiably insane or just a liar.
8. Your desperate need to separate everyone into them & us...  3/
author: JuliaHB1

text:
...Itself discriminatory and insulting to Muslims.
5. Her decision, within hours of 49 people being massacred, to cynically use their deaths as an opportunity to push her political agenda is most definitely despicable.
6. I didn’t portray myself as an ally of anyone 2/
author: JuliaHB1

text:
1. The validity of a criticism doesn’t depend on the religion or race of the critic
2. She didn’t have a case at all.
3. Criticising a religious ideology or mode of dress doesn’t dehumanise anyone.
4. Treating Muslims as a special protected group immune from any criticism is...1/
author: JuliaHB1

text: Just watched that Comic Relief Four Weddings sequel. All credit to everyone who gave their services for a great cause but God, it was terrible. Not one funny line, so smug and painfully woke. Such a disappointment. Why can’t comedy just be funny anymore?
author: JuliaHB1

text: No, she isn’t right. I haven’t legitimised anything remotely despicable in language or action. You are either cynical or stupid to claim I have. I fear you are both.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Never claimed to be a victim of anything actually. Happy to help.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Don’t play the dead mother card in such a cynical way to try to shut down criticism of your inane tweet. You can’t complain about someone judging you when you are making such a foul judgement of me.
author: JuliaHB1

text: You’re a confirmed idiot.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Correction: he’s a SENIOR law lecturer (or a “law senior lecturer”, as he rather weirdly calls it)
author: JuliaHB1

text: They are misinformed, ignorant and indoctrinated
author: JuliaHB1

text: You’re an idiot.
author: JuliaHB1

text: I am a freelance journalist with many different sources of income. My tax arrangements are 100% legal & typical of people in my field. I avoid tax I’m not due to pay, just as people buy ISAs or duty free booze at airports. I assume you don’t listen to those tax avoiders either.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Kids are dumb, aren’t they?
author: JuliaHB1

text: You’re wrong on every point, I’m afraid.
author: JuliaHB1

text: I think you need to listen to my radio show before you make judgement. You’ve clearly never listened to it.
author: JuliaHB1

text: How?
author: JuliaHB1

text: BTW, I didn’t choose this spat but I won’t stay quiet when accused like this. I spent 3.5 harrowing hours this morning on my radio show talking to survivors and witnesses to this horrific massacre. We should come together on days like this, not seek to create more division.
author: JuliaHB1

text: “Your ilk”.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Yes. People expressing their views on issues like religion in a free society like the U.K. are not only legitimate, they are vital. Such expressions don’t remotely explain, contribute to or justify someone murdering people for their faith. It’s a nonsense to suggest they do.
author: JuliaHB1

text: I didn’t choose to share it today. Nesrine did. I posted it to her, not as a tweet to all my followers.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Guardian columnist @NesrineMalik is busily tweeting comments by people, inc me, making legitimate criticisms of both Islam & Islamic extremists, with the implicit nod & a wink that we are somehow responsible for today’s horrific mosque terror attacks. Nesrine, you are despicable.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Yep, in 2006 I wrote that in a column about free speech. Here is the full article. Happy to stand by it today - except now I think we should ban all face veils. Bugger all to do with today’s horrific terror attack on a mosque but I’m sure you knew that already.
author: JuliaHB1

text: No, I haven’t. Not once, not ever, not on the radio, not on Twitter, not in private. I have never incited hatred against Muslims. You are a liar and an idiot.
author: JuliaHB1

text: Thanks so much to everyone who has sent me lovely messages after last night’s @bbcquestiontime. Too many to thank you individually but I really appreciate it. Keep fighting the good Brexit fight, folks.
author: JuliaHB1
